alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...EASTERN COSHOCTON...NORTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTHERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Coshocton to 8 miles south of West Lafayette. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Coshocton, Uhrichsville, Newcomerstown, West Lafayette, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Baltic, Midvale, Port Washington, and Barnhill. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 53 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
